Study Mode: For the “Biomedicine Doctorate Course” (first year) the mode is daytime with disciplines in workin hours and other after working hours. In the subsequent years the student has different possibilities to distribute the time dedicated to develop the research project. The course includes face to face and e-learning activities.

Course Name: Communication Studies: Technology, Culture and Society * (Association)

Study Mode: Lectures taught every fridays and saturdays.
The course respects the daily work hours and includes e-learning.

The course is designed to be compatible with other professional activities, namely with clinical practice. The first year of the course includes on-site tutorials, and lessons and assignments in e-learning platform, of which most are attended after working hours. In the subsequent years of the course, the student may manage and distribute the time that is dedicated to the research project, under the supervision of a PhD supervisor. The PhD supervisor must be a member of the University (UBI). Whenever justified, a supervisor may be appointed together with a co-supervisor, however, at least one of these must belong to UBI.
1st YEAR - Academic Plan; 2nd and 3rd YEAR - Preparation of Thesis.

Tutorial system. The doctoral programme in Textile Engineering comprises 6 semesters corresponding to 180 ECTS. Includes a research component, leading to the development of a doctoral thesis in the area of Textile Science and Technology. To obtain the degree of doctor of Textile Engineering, it becomes necessary the preparation of a doctoral thesis in Textile Engineering, which necessarily involves a work of original research, with a clear contribution to the extension of the frontiers of knowledge in this area.
